intro: Microtropis pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered microtropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Annonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
